intro: Daviesia quadrilatera, commonly known as the Four-angled Daviesia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its unique, four-angled stems and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its floral display, which ranges from yellow to orange, attracts various pollinators such as bees and birds. Daviesia quadrilatera is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability to dry conditions.
